description: This trap indicates that an Unsecure Access Point is detected
by an Air Monitor located at wlsrLocation on channel
wlsrCurrentChannel. The AP is declared unsecure, because we
matched it to the wlsrMatchedMac/wlsrMatchedIp.

event.Summary: Unsecure access point detected on channel $v4 at location $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrUnsecureApDetected WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrTargetApBSSID s EXAMPL WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrTargetApSSID s EXAMPLE WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrLocation s EXAMPLE WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrCurrentChannel i 1 WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrMatchedMac s EXAMPL WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrMatchedIp a 192.0.2.1 WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrRogueInfoURL s EXAMPLE

description: This Object is used in the traps to indicate the BSSID of the
Access Point, for which we are raising the trap. If an
Air Monitor is sending the trap then this will indicate
AP. If an Access Point is sending the trap, then it will point
to itself.

a Station impersonation.

description: The current operating frequency channel of the DSSS PHY.
variables.name: WLSR-AP-MIB::wlsrCurrentChannel

description: This Object is used to point to the WEBGUI Rogue interfering
AP information URL.
